item.title: Make Github Your Own CMS Using Hugo
item.description: Hello everyone. Last a few weeks I was thinking about making ozantopal.com great again. üòÑ On that days, Hugo entered my life, thanks to Furkan’s advice. Hugo is a framework for building websites. It’s actually a static page generator. It’s written with Go and Hugo is quite fast. After all those compliment to Hugo; I would like to return my main subject. Today, I wanna tell you about migration of my blog to Hugo and how I maintain new posts on that new ‘cms’.

item.title: About
item.description: ‚≠ê Chess Player @ lichess.org and Chess.com ‚≠ê Senior Software Engineer @ XYZ Teknoloji ‚≠ê Develops C# and JS and also interests Go Skills I’ve experienced: ‚Üí Architectural Design, Design Patterns ‚Üí Tiered Arch., MVC, MVVM, Microservices ‚Üí OOP, SOLID, TDD, DDD, SOA, ABC, XYZ and any other abbreviations… ‚Üí Scrum, Kanban, Pair Programming, Code Review ‚Üí C#, JS, Go ‚Üí MySQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CosmosDB ‚Üí Azure, AWS, Google Cloud

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello there, this is Ozan and this is next one of my numerous blogging trials. Hopefully, this time I keep continue to blogging. Content of this blog will be mostly about programming but still I do not guarantee that I won’t write on different topics. Until I see you all soon, keep digging!
